title: Vaibbhav and Prarthana tie the knot?
text:
The Yash and Radhika Pandit-starrer 'Mr & Mrs Ramachari' was one of the most successful movies down South last year and after running in theatres for more than 100 days, it is all set to be released in the form of an official Marathi remake to hit theatres on January 8, 2016.
'Mr & Mrs Sadachari', the Marathi remake, has Marathi actors Vaibbhav Tatwawdi and Prarthana Behere reprising Yash and Radhika's roles of lovers, respectively. It was slated to release on December 4, almost a year after the Kannada film, which was released on December 25, 2014.
READ: Vaibhav changes name
The success of the Kannada film was such that it ran for over 100 days at theatres. It even bagged several awards, including best film, best actor, best actress, best director, best music director, best lyricist and even those playing supporting roles.
Santhosh Ananddram, the director of Mr & Mrs Ramachari confirmed to Belgaum Times that 'Mr & Mrs Sadachari' is indeed the official remake of his movie, adding that the rights have been given for the movie to be remade in Tamil, Telugu and Hindi as well. Apart from this, 'Mr & Mrs Ramachari' will also be dubbed in Malayalam, Punjabi and Bhojpuri.
Interestingly, Vaibbhav and Prarthana are rumoured to be dating in real life and seeing them as a couple in the upcoming film is sure to spark interest in their personal lives.
